newsitem.title: USA: Colonial buys Fort Brooke in $33.6 mln deal.
newsitem.headline: Colonial buys Fort Brooke in $33.6 mln deal.

text.p: Alabama-based Colonial BancGroup Inc and Florida-based Fort Brooke Bancorporation have signed a letter of intent to let Colonial buy Fort Brooke, both banks said Tuesday.

The banks said Colonial will exchange stock to equal $31.50 per share for Fort Brooke's outstanding shares, a value of $31.7 million. Colonial will also assume Fort Brooke's options based on $31.50 per share, bringing the total value to about $33.6 million. The transaction will be accounted for as a pooling of interests, the banks said.
The deal requires regulatory and Fort Brooke shareholder approval.

Colonial BancGroup, a multi-bank holding company, said it has assets of $4.7 billion and 132 offices in Alabama, Florida, Georgia and Tennessee. Fort Brooke had $186 million in assets, $16.3 million in capital and earnings of $1 million on June 30, the banks said. It operates eight offices in the greater Tampa area.
The deal would merge Fort Brooke Bank in Brandon, Florida, into Colonial's Florida bank, the banks said.
